```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)
library(tidyverse)
library(knitr)
```

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
x <- read_csv("polls_IT-parliament_2018-10-01.csv") %>%
  select(date, firm, n, LN, M5S) %>%
  gather(key = "party", value = "percentage", LN, M5S) 

x %>%
  ggplot(aes(date, percentage, color = party)) + geom_point(alpha = 0.3)
```

The purpose of this document is to show polling results in Italy.

```{r, message=FALSE}
y <- read_csv("polls_IT-parliament_2018-10-01.csv") %>%
  select(date, firm, n, LN, M5S, PD, FIPDLFI) %>%
  gather(key = "party", value = "percentage", LN:FIPDLFI) %>%
  ggplot(aes(date, percentage, color = party)) + geom_point(size = 0.6, alpha = 0.3) + geom_smooth() + xlab("Date") +ylab("Percentage")
```
